titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rae Armantrout Papers, circa 1970-2001 M.1211

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: The collection documents Rae Armantrout's writing career from the 1970's through 2001.
did.physloc: Special Collections materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.

prefercite.head: Preferrred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Rae Armantrout papers, M1211. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research, except box 22, which is closed until 2021.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession numbers: MSS.2001-095, MSS.2001-140. This collection was purchased by Stanford University, Special Collections in April and May 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, notebooks, typescripts, teaching materials, and photographs. Much of the correspondence, from the late 1970's to the present, consists of substantive letters and emails from other poets and writers, including Fanny Howe, Lyn Hejinian, Bob Perelman, and Ron Silliman. The notebooks in the collection record random thoughts from which Armantrout's poems often evolve, as well as multiple versions of both published and unpublished work. The collection also includes typescripts for Armantrout's books, including Precedence (1985), Necromance (1989), Made to Seem (1995), True (1996), as well as typescripts for other miscellaneous poems and essays. Teaching materials in the collection consist of Armantrout's lecture notes, syllabi, and course readers for classes on poetry and personal narrative taught at the University of California, San Diego from the mid-1980's to the present.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The poet and essayist Rae Armantrout was born in Vallejo, California on 13 April 1947 and grew up in San Diego. Graduating from the University of California, Berkeley in 1970, she later received a Master's degree in creative writing at San Francisco State University in 1975. Armantrout is the author of many books, including, among others, Extremities (1978), The Invention of Hunger (1979), Precedence (1985) Necroromance (1991), Made to Seem (1995), Writing the Plot about Sets (1998), True (a memoir, 1998), The Pretext (2001), Veil: New and Selected Poems (2001), Up to Speed (2004), and Next Life (2007). A founding member of the West Coast "Language Poetry" movement, Armantrout worked closely with a dynamic group of writers including Ron Silliman, Lyn Hejinian, Bob Perelman, Steve Benson, Barret Watten, Tom Mandel, and Carla Harryman. Although Language poetry can be seen as advocating a poetics of nonreferentiality, Armantrout's work, focusing as it often does on the local and the domestic, resists such definitions. Internationally known, Armantrout's work has been the subject of numerous essays (some of which are gathered in A Wild Salience: The Writings of Rae Armantrout, a collection dedicated to her work), and an entry in the Dictionary of Literary Biography (vol. 193). Currently, she teaches at the University of California, San Diego.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in five series:

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Fanny Howe Papers, M0648, M0768, M0848

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains incoming letters, postcards, and printed emails. Typescripts and other materials originally included with the correspondence have been retained in this series.

did.unittitle: DuPlessis, Rachel Blau, 1984-1998: letters, postcards, emails
Evans, Steve and Jennifer Moxley, 1989-1992: letters, greeting card
Hejinian, Lyn, 1977-1995: letters, signed broadside, postcards, typescripts, emails
Howe, Fanny, 1994-2000: emails. Closed until Jan. 1, 2021.
Jorris, Pierre and Jerome Rothenberg, 1996: letter
Killian, Kevin and Dodie Bellamy, 1996-2000: emails, letter
Leddy, Michael, 1991-1995: letters, postcards, typescripts, essay on Armantrout
Messerli, Douglas, 1985-1997: letters, postcards, publishing agreement
Moriarty, Laura, 1994-2000: letters, emails, wedding invitation
Perelman, Bob, 1978-1994: letters, postcards, typescripts, some with annotations by Armantrout
Perelman, Bob, 1994-2001: emails; includes poems, some with annotations by Armantrout.
Reed, Pat, no date: greeting card
Wheeler, Susan, 1997-2000: emails; includes typescript essay on Armantrout.
Miscellaneous correspondence: mostly emails; some letters, cards, typescripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The notebooks in this series contain drafts and notes for published and unpublished poems, as well as miscellaneous notes. Dated notebooks are arranged chronologically, followed by undated notebooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains typescripts, proofs, periodicals, clippings, and other materials relating to Armantrout's publications and reading engagements. Loose typescripts by other writers have also been included in this series.

did.unittitle: Clippings, circa 1986-1995: newspaper and magazine articles by or about Armantrout
Davis, Lydia, circa 1994: End of the Story typescript
Interview, 1987: typescript interview of Armantrout by Lori Chamberlain
Lazer, Alexander, no date: typescript of essay on Armantrout
Necromance, 1989: typescript; includes letter from Sun and Moon Press.
Page Mothers, 1999: typescript essays by Armantrout and others
Perelman, Bob, 1998: annotated proof for The Future of Memory
Sun and Moon Press, 1992-1993: royalty statements, publishing agreement
Typescripts, no date: poems and essays, many with extensive annotations
Wesleyan University Press, 1999-2001: emails, publishing agreement for American Women Poets of the Twenty First Century
Miscellaneous writing, no date: typescript essays by Armantrout and others; includes flyers for readings and conferences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains teaching materials, such as course readers and handouts from courses taught by Armantrout at the University of California, San Diego.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This small series includes one black and white portrait of Armantrout from a 1982 reading, snapshots from a later reading with Ron Silliman, and other miscellaneous snapshots of Armantrout and others.
